Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.final_project_beta1.Navigation.Navigation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class contains methods which can make robot travel on the field.
    Author:
    Xiangyun Wang

      private static int convertAngle(double radius, double width, double angle)
      This method take the radius of wheels, width of the robot and the angle needs to be rotated by the robot, to calculate the rotation needs to make by wheels to turn a certain angle to a certain direction
      private static int convertDistance(double radius, double distance)
      This method takes the radius of wheels and the distance that needs to be traveled, and calculate the rotation of the wheels need to make to travel that distance

      Gets the minimum value between 180 and negative 180.

      static void headForward(int speed) 
      static void spin(java.lang.Boolean dir, int angle, int speed, boolean immediate)
      This method makes the robot turn clockwise or counter clockwise.
      static void travelTo(double x, double y, boolean immediate, int speed)
      The following method is used to make the robot go to a preset location We first calculate the distance that needs to be traveled and the angle we are traveling towards by taking the difference between the position we want to go to and our current position
      static void turnBackward()
      The following method is used to make the robot turn backwards
      static void turnTo(double theta)
      This method allows us to get the minimum angle and turn to it so that our robot can travel to the next point by doing the difference between theta and the current angle

      • travelTo

        public static void travelTo(double x,
                            double y,
                            boolean immediate,
                            int speed)
        The following method is used to make the robot go to a preset location We first calculate the distance that needs to be traveled and the angle we are traveling towards by taking the difference between the position we want to go to and our current position
        Parameters:
        x - x value of the target position
        y - y value of the target position
        immediate - whether or not to return immediately
        speed - speed while traveling

      • turnTo

        public static void turnTo(double theta)
        This method allows us to get the minimum angle and turn to it so that our robot can travel to the next point by doing the difference between theta and the current angle
        Parameters:
        theta - target direction

      • spin

        public static void spin(java.lang.Boolean dir,
                        int angle,
                        int speed,
                        boolean immediate)
        This method makes the robot turn clockwise or counter clockwise.
        Parameters:
        dir - direction to spin (true for clockwise, false for counterclockwise)
        angle - amount of angle to spin

      • getMinAngle

        public static double getMinAngle(double angle)
        Gets the minimum value between 180 and negative 180.
        Parameters:
        angle - input angle
        Returns:
        angle minimum angle to rotate

      • convertDistance

        private static int convertDistance(double radius,
                                   double distance)
        This method takes the radius of wheels and the distance that needs to be traveled, and calculate the rotation of the wheels need to make to travel that distance
        Parameters:
        radius - is the wheel radius
        distance - is the distance needs to be traveled
        Returns:
        rotation of the wheels

      • convertAngle

        private static int convertAngle(double radius,
                                double width,
                                double angle)
        This method take the radius of wheels, width of the robot and the angle needs to be rotated by the robot, to calculate the rotation needs to make by wheels to turn a certain angle to a certain direction
        Parameters:
        radius - is the radius of wheels
        width - is the width of the robot
        angle - is the angle needs to be turned by the robot
        Returns:
        rotation of wheels
